name: Which Peanut Am I? Quiz | Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: I love to write stories that start with "It was a dark and stormy night..." and my best friend is Woodstock. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Snoopy.

	Snoopy first wrote "It was a dark and stormy night..." in a comic strip that appeared on July 12, 1965.

questions.text: "Good grief!" all my friends think I"m a "blockhead". I really love the "little red haired girl". Do you know who I am?
questions.explanation:
Charlie Brown.

	In the comic strips the "little red haired" girl that Charlie Brown has a crush on is not seen, nor is she named, however, in 1977, on a TV special she is seen and her name is revealed to be Heather.

questions.text: "!! !!!! !!!!!! !! !!!!!!" !!! !! !? (Translation: My best friend is Snoopy. Who am I?)
questions.explanation:
Woodstock.

	Woodstock speaks only in birdspeak, which in the comics shows up as exclamation points.

questions.text: I heard you were coming, I'm just sitting here with my blue blanket waiting for the Great Pumpkin. Do you know my name?
questions.explanation:
Linus.

	Linus first got his blanket on June 1, 1954. His sister doesn't understand his need for it, but  he does not intend to get rid of it anytime soon.

questions.text: I'm pretty enough to play the Christmas queen. I love Schroeder, but I swear he likes his piano more than me. Wait, I have a fun idea..."I'll hold this football and you can kick it." First, tell me my name please.
questions.explanation:
Lucy.

	Lucy is Linus' older sister. She is very grouchy, and bossy. She is often trying to make her brother give up his security blanket or is trying to get Charlie Brown to kick a football which she likes to pull away so he will go flying.

questions.text: Have you seen my "Sweet Baboo". "Isn't he the cutest thing?" Oh, one more thing, can you tell me who I am?
questions.explanation:
Sally.

	Sally is Charlie Brown's little sister. She is very into receiving gifts at Christmas which frustrates Charlie Brown who is looking for the real meaning of Christmas. She is completely in love with Linus who wishes she would just go away.

questions.text: I wish Lucy would leave me alone so I can practice my piano. I love Beethoven, there is no one in the world greater than he. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Schroeder.

	Schroeder introduced classical music to the Peanuts gang and in doing so he made classical music known to generations of children who otherwise might never be exposed. Schroeder never has any interest in Lucy who is clearly in love with him, and according to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schroeder_%28Peanuts%29 this is due to the fact that Beethoven was a bachelor all his life, and Schroder wants to be exactly like his hero.

questions.text: Hey Chuck, have you seen "the funny looking kid who plays shortstop"? I can't find him anywhere, and I have to ask him...what is my name?
questions.explanation:
Peppermint Patty.

	Peppermint Patty is a very friendly but not too bright girl who hangs around with Marcie all the time. She gets mostly D-minuses in school and thinks that Snoopy is human. She is the only one to call Charlie Brown, Chuck.

questions.text: People complain that I am so filthy all the time, but it's just a little dirt. Do you know my name?
questions.explanation:
Pigpen.

	Pigpen was introduced in the comics on July 13, 1954. He is known for bringing a cloud of dust with him everywhere he goes.

questions.text: I met Charlie Brown at the beach once. We had so much fun he invited me over for a play date. I got to school with Peppermint Patty and play baseball on her team. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Franklin.

	Franklin first met Charlie Brown on July 31, 1968. People though Schulz did it as a political statement but he simply felt like introducing a new character and decided to make him African American.
